title: Mormon Pioneer National Historic Trail: Oxen
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     People     Oxen                Oxen - Engines of the Overland Emigration        Baby Zeus (left) and Thor, two young oxen, learning to bear a yoke. Dixon Ford photograph       Dixon Ford, of Fruit Heights, Utah, devoted much of his life to training and driving oxen using techniques he learned from his Mormon pioneer grandfather. In this article he explains what oxen are, how they were traditionally trained to draw wagons, and how they are properly driven and cared for. Emigrant accounts triumphs and tragedies involving oxen on the overland trails are woven through this narrative. Read the article here.
